alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 2:42PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended in the area, but runoff is causing flooding issues. Duck Creek at Macksburg is approaching flood stage, with nearby roads closed as a result. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
